newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin sees "complications" from Iraq raids.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin sees "complications" from Iraq raids.

text.p: President Boris Yeltsin, backing his government's condemnation of U.S. missile raids on Iraq, sees serious complications from the attack, the president's chief-of-staff said on Wednesday.

Interfax news agency quoted Anatoly Chubais as saying the reaction of the president, who is on vacation outside Moscow, showed "all the seriousness of this political event, which is fraught with serious complications".
Russian officials have already reacted sharply to the raids, which the United States said were in retaliation for Iraqi attacks in Kurdish regions of northern Iraq.
Chubais said Yeltsin's administration was watching events closely and viewed new air strikes as "impermissable".
"The situation is rather dramatic and we are following it attentively," he said. "We consider it a political event which could be very dangerous."

Foreign Minister Yevgeny Primakov, visiting Switzerland and Liechtenstein, has said Russia viewed the raids very negatively. "Such a system could lead to catastrophic consequences. I am speaking not only about regional affairs, but about the world order," he said.
